titleStmt.title: Dialogues in the English and Malaiane languages: or, Certaine common formes of speech, first written in Latin, Malaian, and Madagascar tongues, by the diligence and painfull endeuour of Master Gotardus Arthusius, a Dantisker, and now faithfully translated into the English tongue by Augustine Spalding Merchant, for their sakes, who happily shall hereafter vndertake a voyage to the East-Indies
titleStmt.author: Arthus, Gotthard, b. 1568.
Spalding, Augustine.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Felix Kyngston for William Welby, and are to bee sold at his shop in Pauls Church-yard, at the signe of the Swan,

notesStmt.note: Spalding's dedication specifies that he took "speciall care for the correction of such errors as were committed in the first edition", presumably STC 810.5--STC.
Imperfect; title page stained and torn.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Pauls Church-yard, at the signe of the Swan
